creator: berniedurfee@gmail.com
text:
There should be a way to tell the 'copy' task to not be concerned when a 
file/directory to be copied does not exist.

The 'copy' task should have a 'quiet' attribute which act the same way 
the 'quiet' attribute does on the 'delete' task. When copying files or 
directories from multiple components, it is common that some components have 
those files/directories, while others don't. So the warning messages being 
logged are not relavent.

I agree. Please also don't include artificial restriction that quiet and
failonerror attributes can't both be set to true (as requested recently in bug
#42787).

'quiet' controls what a task should display on screen while 'failonerror'
controls how a task works. They're independent IMHO.
